info.title: PortaBilling JSON API Reference Guide
info.description: This document provides information for developers who want to interface their applications with PortaBilling via JSON API

number.description: Credit card number without spaces, e.g. 4444333322221111

account_number.description: Bank account number. Applicable to the Check and DirectDebitNL methods

processing_type.description: Processing type of the payment method

city.description: Name of the city of the cardholder

i_country_subdivision.description: ID for cardholder's state; refers to Country_Subdivision table

i_payment_method.description: Unique ID of the payment method

start_date.description: Card activation date. Applicable to the Switch method

token.description: A reference to the payment information (which is stored by the Payment Processor only)

bank_number.description: Bank routing number. Applicable to the Check method

exp_date.description: Card expiration date. Applicable to all credit card methods

issue_no.description: Card issue number. Applicable to the Switch method

name.description: Name of the cardholder (owner of a bank account, etc.)

phone_number.description: Phone number in E.164 format for validating the Credit Card

number_hash.description: A crypted hexadecimal code of the credit card number

payment_method.description: Name of the payment method, one of the following: Cash, Cheque, American Express, Discover, MasterCard, VISA, Maestro, Check, DirectDebitNL. Pass undefined value in order to dismiss payment method

zip.description: Postal code of the cardholder. Possible length: 2–10 symbols. You can use letters, digits and symbols ' ' (space) and '-' (dash)

csc_required.description: Shows whether card security code is required or not

cvv.description: Card security code (CVV, CVS, etc.). Applicable to all credit card methods

time_stamp.description: The timestamp when the status will be applied to the customer

status_name.description: The human-readable name of the status

generate_invoice_earlier.description: Defines whether an invoice will be generated before the end of the billing period

i_status.description: The unique ID of the scheduled customer status change

i_custom_field.description: The unique ID of the custom field. Either the 'i_custom_field' or the 'name' is required for the 'update_custom_fields_values' method

i_custom_field_value.description: The unique ID of the custom field value. The field is ignored in the 'update_custom_fields_values' method request

db_value.description: Database value of the custom field

password.description: Password, as specified on web interface

enable_csrf_protection.description: The flag shows whether to permanently enable CSRF protection for the session

token.description: The API access token of a user

login.description: User Name, as specified on web interface

warning_threshold.description: Warning threshold value. NOTE: For postpaid customers, balance warning thresholds can be defined either as amounts or as percentages of a positive Permanent Credit Limit value. For prepaid customers, balance warning thresholds can be defined only as an amount of an Available Funds value

type.description: Type of the warning threshold. Possible values: A - absolute amount, P - percent

password.description: The user password for the PortaBilling web interface

session_id.description: The unique ID of a previously opened SOAP session (used without a login)

token.description: The API access token of a user. Сan be used instead of a password to set up the session

login.description: The user login for the PortaBilling web interface. Should be used together with one of the following: password, token

session_id.description: The unique ID of the newly opened session

locked.description: Specifies whether the feature is locked for editing for current user or not. If absent in response, then the feature can’t be locked

flag_value.description: Value of the corresponding service_flag item. Note that for the cli_trust and permitted_sip_proxies service features the flag_value property is not mandatory

defined.description: Shows whether the service feature is defined on the object's service features level or not. If absent in the response, it means that the feature is always defined on the object's service features level

effective_flag_value.description: A value of the service feature. It can be received in one of the two ways: inherited by the account from the customer, customer site or the product; inherited by the customer site from the customer

inclusive_taxation.description: Identifies that taxes are included in rates for a Customer (Y, N)

commission_plan_effective_from.description: The date and time when the commission plan was assigned

i_parent.description: Omit for a direct customer; i_customer of the reseller for a subcustomer

out_date_format.description: Output format for date indication on customer's self-care interface

i_template.description: The unique ID of the customer's regular invoice template; refers to the Templates table. If undefined, the template defined in the customer class is used; if 0, invoices are not created

password.description: Customer's password for self-care web interface

onetime_invoice_generation_enabled.description: Specfies whether out-ofturn invoice generation is enabled. Possible values: 1 - Out-of-turn invoice generation is enabled; 0 - Out-of-turn invoice generation is disabled

send_invoices.description: Defines whether a regular invoice should be automatically sent to the customer as soon as it is created. Possible values: Y - Send invoice; N - Do not send invoice. If undefined, the settings defined in the customer class are applied

i_commission_plan.description: The ID of the overridden commission plan for this customer

is_used.description: Shows whether the customer has entities assigned

bill_status.description: O - the customer is open, S - the customer is suspended due to an overdue invoice, C - the customer is closed due to an unpaid invoice, E - the customer is exported

name.description: The ID of the customer on the PortaBilling® interface, unique in the billing environment

i_tariff.description: The unique ID of the customer's tariff; refers to Tariffs table; applies to resellers only

i_role.description: The unique ID of the customer's access role; refers to the Roles table

login.description: Customer's login for self-care web interface

max_abbreviated_length.description: Maximum allowed length of customer's abbreviated numbers; applies to retail customers only

pdf_generation_mode.description: Generate Invoice PDF: C - At the end of the billing period; R - Postponed, based on resource availability; D - On demand

creation_date.description: Date and time when the customer was created

ui_time_zone_name.description: The unique ID of the customer's user interface time zone; refers to the Time_Zones table

i_time_zone.description: The unique ID of the customer's time zone; refers to Time_Zones table

i_number_scope_reseller.description: The identifier of the invoice sequence numbers scope for the reseller

i_balance_control_type.description: Customer balance control type. Possible values: 1 - Postpaid (default); 2 - Prepaid

credit_exceed.description: Specifies if customer's credit limit has been exceeded

ot_send_invoices.description: Defines whether an out-of-turn invoice should be automatically sent to the customer as soon as it is created. Possible values: Y – Send invoice, N – Do not send invoice. The default value is Y

send_statistics.description: Defines what kind of xDR statistics should be delivered to the customer by email: F - send full statistics to customer; S - send short statistics; N - do not send statistics. If undefined, the settings defined in the customer class are applied

i_tariff_incoming.description: The unique ID of the customer's incoming tariff; refers to Tariffs table; applies to resellers only

i_billing_processor.description: The unique ID of the taxation method. If blank then the taxation method defined for the customer class is used. 0 means that taxes are included in the rate

callshop_enabled.description: Enable callshop features on customer's self-care interface

deactivate_on.description: The date when the customer will be deactivated

country.description: The code of the country in the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format

i_do_batch.description: The unique ID of the Owner DID Batch used for DID numbers auto-provisioning

i_distributor.description: The unique ID of the distributor record associated with the customer

generate_invoice_earlier.description: Defines whether an invoice will be generated before the end of the billing period (Y, N)

tax_info.description: The configured taxation method options. For example: vat_exempt=no;vat_percen t=20;vat_cdr_per_service= 0

invoice_generation_enabled.description: Specifies whether invoice generation is enabled

notepad.description: When making changes in the customer record, the administrator can use the Notepad tab to provide a comment detailing the reason for these changes (for example, "product changed, credited $50")

credit_limit_until.description: Date and time when the temporarily extended credit limit will be automatically reverted to the original value

shifted_billing_date.description: This is applicable only for "monthly anniversary" and 30-day billing periods; allows you to set the billing date to a different day of the month in the future (used only in requests)

new_i_billing_period.description: The unique ID of the customer's future billing period; refers to the Billing_Period table

iso_4217.description: ISO4217 code for currency in which the customer is billed

suspension_delay_date.description: The date when the customer will be suspended

i_customer_class.description: The unique ID of the customer class; refers to Customer_Classes table

has_custom_fields.description: Shows that the customer has additional information stored in custom fields

out_date_time_format.description: Output format for full date/time indication

temp_credit_limit.description: Value by which the customer's credit limit will be temporarily increased. Allows to extend the customer’s credit limit until a certain date

ip_filter.description: The list of IP addresses the customer can log into PortaBilling from

time_zone_name.description: The name of the customer's time zone

i_lang.description: Code for customer's web language; refers to Languages table

bill_suspension_delayed.description: Shows whether suspension of customer's services has been delayed

i_traffic_profile.description: The identifier of the traffic profile

bp_charge_cc.description: Automatically charge customer's credit card when billing period is closed. "As defined by the Customer Class" is used if empty

address_line_2.description: The 2nd line of the customer's address. It will contain all baddr2, baddr3, baddr4 and baddr5 fields separated by the '\n' symbol

zip.description: Postal (zip) code. Possible length: 2–10 symbols. You can use letters, digits and symbols ' ' (space) and '-' (dash)

discount_rate.description: The value of customer's subscription discount; a percentage

estimate_taxes.description: Marks that Customer configured taxes to apply at the moment of payment

ot_i_template.description: The unique ID of the template for the out-of-turn invoice

sale_commission_rate.description: The commission that is applied when an account is created or a distributor is assigned (only applicable to distributor)

balance_transfer_allowed.description: Defines if balance transfer is enabled for a Customer (Y, N)

scheduled_billing_change.description: A date when the billing period will close and a new billing period and a new time zone will be applied

terminate_on.description: The date when the customer will be terminated

i_main_office.description: The unique ID of the main office (customer record with office type 3)

restore_on.description: The date when the customer status will be returned to Open

i_ui_time_zone.description: The unique ID of the the customer's user interface time zone; refers to the Time_Zones table

i_vd_plan.description: The unique ID of the customer's discount plan; refers to Volume_Discount_Plans table

email_from.description: Email Address for Reseller to use as Sender Email for Customer Notifications

new_i_time_zone.description: The unique ID of the customer's future time zone; refers to the Time_Zones table

password_lifetime.description: Customer's self-care WI password life time (in seconds)

euuid.description: The unique identifier of the environment

override_tariffs_enabled.description: Specifies whether the Override Tariffs feature is enabled: Y - enabled, N - disabled

suspend_on_insuff_funds.description: Specifies whether to suspend the customer on insufficient funds for charging subscriptions: Y - automatically suspend prepaid customers whose funds are not sufficient to cover pending subscription charges; N - do not suspend customers; Empty - the settings defined in the customer class are applied

i_rep.description: The unique ID of the customer's representative; refers to Representatives table

password_timestamp.description: Date when the password was changed

i_number_scope.description: PortaBilling can generate invoices for all customers with sequential invoice numbering distributed throughout the environment. In some cases, you may want to have more than one sequence of numbers. One of the following: 1 – Individual for Environment, 2 – Individual for Reseller, 3 – Individual for Customer

service_flags.description: Customer's service features settings. Note that this property is read-only (the add_customer and update_customer methods ignore it) and it is used in the get_customer_info and get_customer_list responses as informative. To change customer's service features use the service_features property

i_office_type.description: The unique ID of the Office_Types record. Possible values: 1 – none; 2 – branch_office; 3 – main_office

next_billed_to.description: The date of the end of the current billing period for the customer

i_billing_period.description: The unique ID of the customer's billing period; refers to Billing_Period table

purge_after_months.description: Shows when customer personal data will be deleted. -1 - functionality is disabled, 0 - immediately, N - delete in N months, NULL - inherited from the customer class

payment_commission_rate.description: The commition applied when payment is entered (only applicable to distributor)

api_token.description: The API token of the customer. You can use tokens instead of the standard login-password pairs for authenticating your applications integrated with PortaBilling via API

i_customer.description: The unique ID of the customer record

i_acl.description: The unique ID of the customer's access level; refers to the Access_Levels table

bundle_billed_to.description: Any bundles earlier than this date and time are already calculated

credit_limit.description: Customer's credit limit value. Note that this property may be used with the nil attribute set to true, in which case the credit limit will not be enforced

skip_exported.description: Specifies whether the customers with 'bill_status'='E' should be excluded from the response

invoicing_enabled.description: Filters customer list by their invoicing status. Possible values: 1 - Invoicing enabled; 0 - Invoicing disabled

iso_4217.description: ISO4217 code for currency in which the customer is billed

i_parent.description: The unique ID of the reseller who manages the customer

i_customer_class.description: The unique ID of the customer class; refers to Customer_Classes table

get_statuses.description: Get the statuses of the customers

bill_status.description:
The billing status of the customer to search by.
Possible values: O, S, C, E, D.
 O – The customer is open.
 S – The customer is suspended due to an overdue invoice.
 C – The customer is closed due to an unpaid invoice.
 E – The customer is exported.
 D – The customer is deactivated due to provisional termination.

i_main_customer.description: The unique ID of the "main" customer (Main Office (HQ) customer) record within one linked customers' group

login.description: Customer's login for self-care web interface

get_auth_info.description: If set to '1', the information about the customer's authorization parameters will be provided in the response

detailed_info.description: Specifies whether detailed information will be returned in the response

with_terminated.description: Specifies whether to include terminated customers into the list. Possible values: 1 - Include terminated customers into the list; 0 - Do not include terminated customers into the list

i_customer_type.description: The type of the customer. Possible values: 1 - Retail customer or subcustomer, 2 - Reseller, 3 - Distributor

check_usage.description: Check whether the customer has entities assigned

callshop_enabled.description: Filter the customer list by the 'callshop_enabled' field

get_total.description: Get the total number of the retrieved customers

with_subresellers.description: Specifies whether to include subresellers into the list. Possible values: 1 - Include subresellers into the list; 0 - Do not include subresellers into the list

limit.description: The number of rows to retrieve

offset.description: The number of rows to skip at the beginning of the list

i_distributor.description: The unique ID of the distributor whose subdistributors you want to retrieve

i_rep.description: The unique ID of the customer's representative; refers to Representatives table

get_notepad.description: Specifies whether to include the notes into the info. Possible values: 1 - Include the notes into the info; 0 - Do not include the notes into the info

i_office_type.description: The unique ID of the Office_Types record. Possible values: 1 – none; 2 – branch_office; 3 – main_office

has_invoices.description: Filters customer list by invoice presence. Possible values: 1 - Return customers with at least one invoice present; 0 - Return customers with no invoices

auto_close_on.description: The timestamp when the customer's billing period will be automatically closed

is_closing_scheduled.description: Shows whether the customer's billing period is scheduled to be closed

effective_values.description: Get customer info (including the values that were overridden or inherited from other entities)

detailed_info.description: Specifies whether detailed information will be returned in the response

name.description: The ID of the customer on the PortaBilling interface, unique in the environment

get_main_office_info.description: If set to '1', information will be provided for the requested Branch Office (site) customer about the Main Office (HQ) customer which is linked with it

with_reseller_info.description: If with_reseller_info == 1 then return information about reseller

login.description: User Name, as specified on web interface

get_auth_info.description: If set to '1', the information about the customer's authorization parameters will be provided in the response

get_time_zone_name.description: If set to '1', the customer's time zone will be provided in the response; refers to Time_Zones table

i_customer.description: The unique ID of the customer record

get_rt_auth_info.description: If set to '1', the customer's RT information will be provided in the response

total.description: The total number of the retrieved customers

post.summary: login - This method checks the validity of login and password or token and returns the session_id on success. API Fault is thrown on failure

200.description: Successful response of the API method

500.description: Failed response of the API method

post.summary: get_customer_list - This method allows an API user to get a list of customer records. The customer must be viewable (or owned) by the user making the request

200.description: Successful response of the API method

500.description: Failed response of the API method

post.summary: get_customer_info - This method allows an API user to get a customer record from the database. The customer must be viewable (owned) by the user making the request

200.description: Successful response of the API method

500.description: Failed response of the API method
